qas.question: What was the former 10-year moratorium on the construction of nuclear plants the result of?
What accident caused the delay in plans for the new nuclear power plant in Bern?

answers.text: Department of Environment, Transport, Energy and Communications

qas.question: What is the 2000-watt society initiative designed to cut by more than half by 2050?

context: The former ten-year moratorium on the construction of new nuclear power plants was the result of <a0_0>a citizens' initiative<a0_0/> voted on in 1990 which had passed with 54.5% Yes vs. 45.5% No votes. Plans for a new nuclear plant in the Canton of Bern have been put on hold after the accident at the <a1_0>Fukushima Daiichi power plant in 2011<a1_0/>. The <a2_0>Swiss Federal Office of Energy<a2_0/> (SFOE) is the office responsible for all questions relating to energy supply and energy use within the Federal <a3_0>Department of Environment, Transport, Energy and Communications<a3_0/> (DETEC). The agency is supporting the 2000-watt society initiative to cut <a4_0>the nation's energy use<a4_0/> by more than half by the year 2050.
